answers.answer: Oops I meant being hungry with the title..

I had the same thing in my first pregnancy it was my blood sugar levels.  I didn't have gestational diabetes or anything I just couldn't keep my sugar levels even so when they would crash I would feel panicked and freak out if I didn't eat I felt starved even though I just ate a whole meal just a couple hours before.  So to fix it when I get that feeling I'd drink a little orange juice and wait a few minutes.  Worked every time. But until I realized it I packed on a lot of weight!

I feel that way from time to time, and I agree that it doesn't exactly mean that you have gestational diabetes but with the changes in your hormones everything is out of balance. Just eat snacks throughout the day,  hopefully everything gets better :)
I was the same way with my first pregnancy - I literally didn't leave the house without a snack in my purse!

I think your right about the blood sugar and hormones being off balance. Sometimes if a drink a coke (not often bc of the caffeine) I feel back to normal and ok until its time to eat again. But I know I can't go around drinking coke all day but for some reason it helps a lot.

question: I don't know if it's just me but I'm 18 weeks now and sometime I really feel like I'm about to die if I don't hurry up and eat something! I know this sounds so dramatic but that's how I feel! All of a sudden I'm hungry all the time and if I don't eat right when I start feeling hungry I start feeling so sick. Like for one I get migraines and my stomach starts killing me! Anyone else feel this way??
title: Be hungry
